00139 #define arg_SETATTR4 op->nfs_argop4_u.opsetattr
00140 #define res_SETATTR4 resp->nfs_resop4_u.opsetattr
00141 
00142 int nfs4_op_setattr(  struct nfs_argop4 * op ,   
00143                       compound_data_t   * data,
00144                       struct nfs_resop4 * resp)
00145 {
00146   fsal_attrib_list_t   sattr ;
00147   fsal_attrib_list_t   attr ;
00148   fsal_attrib_list_t   parent_attr ;
00149   cache_inode_status_t cache_status ;
00150   struct timeval       t ;
00151   int                  rc = 0 ;
00152   char                 funcname[] = "nfs4_op_setattr" ;
00153   
00154   resp->resop = NFS4_OP_SETATTR ;
00155   res_SETATTR4.status =  NFS4_OK  ;
00156   
00157   /* If there is no FH */
00158   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Empty( &(data->currentFH  ) ) )
00159     {
00160       res_SETATTR4.status = NFS4ERR_NOFILEHANDLE ;
00161       return res_SETATTR4.status ;  
00162     }
00163   
00164   /* If the filehandle is invalid */
00165   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Invalid( &(data->currentFH ) ) )
00166     {
00167       res_SETATTR4.status = NFS4ERR_BADHANDLE ;
00168       return res_SETATTR4.status ;
00169     }
00170   
00171   /* Tests if the Filehandle is expired (for volatile filehandle) */
00172   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Expired( &(data->currentFH) ) )
00173     {
00174       res_SETATTR4.status = NFS4ERR_FHEXPIRED ;
00175       return res_SETATTR4.status ;
00176     }
00177   
00178   /* Pseudo Fs is explictely a Read-Only File system */
00179   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Pseudo(  &(data->currentFH) ) )
00180     {
00181       res_SETATTR4.status = NFS4ERR_ROFS ;
00182       return res_SETATTR4.status ;
00183     }
00184   
00185   /* Get only attributes that are allowed to be read */
00186   if( !nfs4_Fattr_Check_Access( &arg_SETATTR4.obj_attributes, FATTR4_ATTR_WRITE ) )
00187     {
00188       res_SETATTR4.status = NFS4ERR_INVAL ;
00189       return res_SETATTR4.status ;
00190     }
00191 
00192   /* Ask only for supported attributes */
00193   if( !nfs4_Fattr_Supported( &arg_SETATTR4.obj_attributes ) )
00194     {
00195        res_SETATTR4.status = NFS4ERR_ATTRNOTSUPP ;
00196        return res_SETATTR4.status ;
00197     }
00198 
00199 
00200 
00201   /* Convert the fattr4 in the request to a nfs3_sattr structure */
00202   rc = nfs4_Fattr_To_FSAL_attr( &sattr, &(arg_SETATTR4.obj_attributes) ) ;
00203 
00204   if( rc == 0 )
00205     {
00206       res_SETATTR4.status = NFS4ERR_ATTRNOTSUPP ;
00207       return res_SETATTR4.status ;
00208     }
00209 
00210   if( rc == -1 ) 
00211     {
00212       res_SETATTR4.status = NFS4ERR_BADXDR ;
00213       return res_SETATTR4.status ;
00214     }
00215   
00216   /*
00217    * trunc may change Xtime so we have to start with trunc and finish
00218    * by the mtime and atime 
00219    */
00220   if( FSAL_TEST_MASK( sattr.asked_attributes, FSAL_ATTR_SIZE ) )
00221     {
00222       /* Setting the size of a directory is prohibited */
00223       if( data->current_filetype == DIR_BEGINNING ||  data->current_filetype == DIR_CONTINUE )
00224         {
00225           res_SETATTR4.status = NFS4ERR_ISDIR ;
00226           return res_SETATTR4.status ;
00227         }
00228         
00229 
00230       if( ( cache_status = cache_inode_truncate( data->current_entry,
00231                                                  sattr.filesize,
00232                                                  &parent_attr, 
00233                                                  data->ht, 
00234                                                  data->pclient, 
00235                                                  data->pcontext, 
00236                                                  &cache_status ) ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00237         {
00238           res_SETATTR4.status = nfs4_Errno ( cache_status ) ;
00239           return res_SETATTR4.status ;
00240         }
00241     }
00242   
00243   /* Now, we set the mode */
00244   if( FSAL_TEST_MASK( sattr.asked_attributes, FSAL_ATTR_MODE )  ||
00245       FSAL_TEST_MASK( sattr.asked_attributes, FSAL_ATTR_OWNER ) ||
00246       FSAL_TEST_MASK( sattr.asked_attributes, FSAL_ATTR_GROUP ) ||
00247       FSAL_TEST_MASK( sattr.asked_attributes, FSAL_ATTR_MTIME ) ||
00248       FSAL_TEST_MASK( sattr.asked_attributes, FSAL_ATTR_ATIME ) )
00249     {
00250       /* Check for root access when using chmod */
00251       if( FSAL_TEST_MASK( sattr.asked_attributes, FSAL_ATTR_MODE ) )
00252         {
00253           if(  ( ( sattr.mode & 0x800  ) && 
00254                  ( ( data->pexport->options & EXPORT_OPTION_NOSUID ) == EXPORT_OPTION_NOSUID ) ) ||
00255                ( ( sattr.mode & 0x400  ) && 
00256                  ( ( data->pexport->options & EXPORT_OPTION_NOSGID ) ==  EXPORT_OPTION_NOSGID ) ) )
00257             {
00258               res_SETATTR4.status = NFS4ERR_PERM ;
00259               return  res_SETATTR4.status ;
00260             }
00261         }
00262 
00263 #ifdef _TOTO
00264       /* get the current time */
00265       gettimeofday( &t, NULL ) ;
00266 
00267       /* Set the atime and mtime (ctime is not setable) */
00269       if(  FSAL_TEST_MASK( sattr.asked_attributes, FSAL_ATTR_ATIME ) == SET_TO_SERVER_TIME4 ) 
00270         {
00271           sattr.atime.seconds  = t.tv_sec ;
00272           sattr.atime.nseconds = t.tv_usec  ;
00273         }
00274       
00275       
00276       /* Should we use the time from the client handside or from the server handside ? */
00278       if(  FSAL_TEST_MASK( sattr.asked_attributes, FSAL_ATTR_MTIME ) == SET_TO_SERVER_TIME4 )
00279         {
00280           sattr.mtime.seconds  = t.tv_sec ;
00281           sattr.mtime.nseconds = t.tv_usec ;
00282         }
00283 #endif      
00284       
00285       if(  cache_inode_setattr( data->current_entry,  
00286                                 &sattr,
00287                                 data->ht, 
00288                                 data->pclient, 
00289                                 data->pcontext, 
00290                                 &cache_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00291         {
00292           res_SETATTR4.status = nfs4_Errno( cache_status ) ;
00293           return  res_SETATTR4.status ;
00294         }
00295     }
00296   
00297   /* Set the replyed structure */
00298   res_SETATTR4.attrsset.bitmap4_len = arg_SETATTR4.obj_attributes.attrmask.bitmap4_len ;
00299 
00300   if( ( res_SETATTR4.attrsset.bitmap4_val = (uint32_t *)Mem_Alloc( res_SETATTR4.attrsset.bitmap4_len ) ) == NULL )
00301     {
00302       res_SETATTR4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
00303       return  res_SETATTR4.status ;
00304     }
00305   memset( (char *) res_SETATTR4.attrsset.bitmap4_val, 0, res_SETATTR4.attrsset.bitmap4_len ) ;
00306 
00307   memcpy(  res_SETATTR4.attrsset.bitmap4_val, arg_SETATTR4.obj_attributes.attrmask.bitmap4_val, res_SETATTR4.attrsset.bitmap4_len ) ;
00308   
00309   
00310   /* Exit with no error */
00311   res_SETATTR4.status = NFS4_OK ;
00312   
00313   return res_SETATTR4.status;
00314 } /* nfs4_op_setattr */
00315 
00316 
00327 void nfs4_op_setattr_Free( SETATTR4res * resp )
00328 {
00329   if( resp->status == NFS4_OK )
00330    Mem_Free( resp->attrsset.bitmap4_val ) ;
00331   return ;
00332 } /* nfs4_op_setattr_Free */
